title: Cape Hatteras National Seashore: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar         Ranger and kids seining in salt marshes of Pamlico Sound National Park Service  Ranger programs and special events are available at various locations throughout the park during the spring, summer, and fall. These programs and events range from guided tours of Bodie Island Lighthouse to learning how to seine. Use the calendar below to access our current schedule of events.   You can also check out the park newspaper for the summer program schedule.         Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 27 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Barrier Island Dynamics      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:15 AM Location: Meet at the Hatteras Island Visitor Center Pavilion Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Join a ranger for a look at the wild side of the Outer Banks. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Hurricane Alley      Time: 11:30 AM to 11:45 AM Location: Hatteras Island Visitor Center Pavilion Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 05/28/2016 to 09/04/2016 Hurricanes and nor'easters are a fact of life here. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Light Station Talk      Time: 3:15 PM to 3:45 PM Location: Hatteras Island Museum Porch Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 How tall is it? Why was it built? What is a Fresnel lens? View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Moving History      Time: 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM Location: Hatteras Island Visitor Center Pavillion Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 How would you move a 4,800 ton, 198.6-foot tall brick and stone building 2,900 feet down the beach? View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Fish with a Ranger      Time: 8:00 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Pre-register in person at Hatteras Island Museum Fees: Free     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly  from 05/30/2016 to 09/05/2016 We have poles, but you MUST bring the bait!  Limited to 15 participants. Pre-register in person at the Hatteras Island Museum beginning the Saturday before the program.  You can not pre-register over the phone, email or internet. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Hurricane Alley      Time: 10:45 AM to 11:15 AM Location: Hatteras Island Visitor Center Pavilion Fees: Free!     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly & Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Hurricanes and nor'easters are a fact of life here. Learn how these powerful storms shaped the Outer Banks! View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: All About Sea Turtles      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:45 AM Location: Ocracoke Island Visitor Center Fees: Free     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly  from 05/30/2016 to 09/05/2016 Hands-on activities developed specifically for children that combine education and entertainment. A perfect way to work towards your Junior Ranger badge! View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Barrier Island Nature      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:00 PM Location: Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Sea turtles, shorebirds, seashells, and shoreline migration. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Crabbing with a Ranger      Time: 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Pre-register in person at the Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free!     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly  from 05/30/2016 to 09/05/2016 Learn more about blue crabs and practice the art of catching them. Limited to 25 participants. Pre-register in person at the Ocracoke Visitor Center starting the Saturday prior to the program. You can not pre-register over the phone, email or internet. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Pirates!      Time: 11:00 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free!     Monday, August 15, 2016 Every Monday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly  from 05/30/2016 to 09/05/2016 Ocracoke was a popular place for Blackbeard and other pirates during the early 1700s. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: For Kids: Sea Turtles      Time: 11:30 AM to 12:15 PM Location: Keepers of the Light Amphitheater Fees: Free!     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/02/2016 Join us for an activity-based program on the life and times of the endangered sea turtle. Meet at the Keepers of the Light Amphitheater (45 minutes) View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Morning Bird Walk      Time: 8:00 AM to 9:30 AM Location: Fish cleaning tables near ORV Ramp 44 Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 08/30/2016 The Outer Banks is well known for its abundant bird life. Beginner and experienced birders alike can come explore beach and salt marsh bird habitats. Binoculars are available. Bring bug spray and sunscreen. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Night Sky Over Hatteras      Time: 9:00 PM to 10:00 PM Location: Parking lot near ORV Ramp 43 Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 08/30/2016 Before GPS and radar, mariners used the stars to navigate. Bring your blankets, chairs, bug spray, and telescopes. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: The World at War on Hatteras      Time: 2:30 PM to 2:45 PM Location: Meet at the Hatteras Island Visitor Center Pavilion Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 09/01/2016 Learn of three wars that impacted this island. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Cast Netting      Time: 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Pre-register in advance in person at the Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 08/30/2016 Cast netting is one of the oldest forms of fishing. Limited to 25 participants. Pre-register in person at the Ocracoke Visitor Center starting the Saturday prior to the program. You can not pre-register over the phone, email, or internet. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Morning Bird Walk      Time: 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Hammock Hills Nature Trail Parking Lot Fees: Free!     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 08/30/2016 Cape Hatteras is well known for its abundant bird life. We have binoculars for your to use.  Bring sunscreen and bug spray! View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Ocracoke History       Time: 2:30 PM to 3:00 PM Location: Meet at the Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 08/30/2016 Ocracoke Island has an incredibly rich cultural history.   View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Cast Netting      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:00 AM Location: Pre-register at the Hatteras Island Museum Fees: Free     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Every Wednesday Weekly  from 06/01/2016 to 08/31/2016 Casting a net from shore is one of the oldest methods of fishing. Pre-register in person at the Hatteras Island Museum beginning the Saturday prior to the program. You can not pre-register over the phone, email, or internet. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: All About Sea Turtles      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:15 PM Location: Ocracoke Island Visitor Center Fees: Free     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Every Wednesday Weekly  from 06/01/2016 to 08/31/2016 Hands-on activities developed specifically for children that combine education and entertainment. A perfect way to work on towards your Junior Ranger badge! View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Night Skies      Time: 8:30 PM to 9:30 PM Location: Ocracoke Campground Beach Fees: Free!     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Every Wednesday Weekly  from 06/01/2016 to 08/31/2016 Bring blankets and chairs for an evening of stargazing on the beach! Bring bug spray. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Cape Hatteras Lighthouse Full Moon Climb      Time: 8:00 PM to 8:45 PM,9:00 PM to 9:45 PM Location: Cape Hatteras Lighthouse Fees: Tickets are $8 per adult, and $4 for children (11 and under) and seniors (62 and older)     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Grab your flashlight and experience the Cape Hatteras Lighthouse at night by going on a full moon climb. Tickets are required and are limited! View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Banker Ponies      Time: 9:00 AM to 9:30 AM Location: Ocracoke Pony Pens Fees: Free     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Every Thursday Weekly  from 06/02/2016 to 09/01/2016 The Banker Ponies are definitely an Ocracoke must-see!  Bring bug spray! Not recommended for those with horse allergies.  View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Ocracoke History       Time: 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Ocracoke Visitor Center Fees: Free     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Every Thursday Weekly  from 06/02/2016 to 09/01/2016 Ocracoke Island has an incredibly rich cultural history. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: Soundside Seining      Time: 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Sandy Bay soundside parking lot Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/02/2016 Discover the wonders of the Pamlico Sound by using seining nets to scoop aquatic wildlife from the water. Water shoes that secure onto your feet is required: no flip flops or Crocs. Wear clothing you can get wet. Bring bug spray. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Hatteras Island: US Coast Guard Station Hatteras Inlet Tour      Time: 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM Location: Pre-register in person at the Hatteras Island Museum Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/02/2016 The US Life-Saving Service has a long and heroic history on the Outer Banks. Pre-register in person at the Hatteras Island Museum beginning the Saturday prior to the program. You can not pre-register over the phone, email, or internet. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Banker Ponies      Time: 11:00 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Ocracoke Pony Pens Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/02/2016 The Banker Ponies are definitely an Ocracoke must-see! Bring bug spray! Not recommended for those allergic to horses. View Details      Cape Hatteras National Seashore Ocracoke Island: Outer Banks Bird Walk      Time: 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM Location: Hatteras Ferry parking lot on north end of the island Fees: Free!     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 05/27/2016 to 09/02/2016 Binoculars are available.  Bring bug spray and sunscreen! View Details
